notes.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Service Mesh 2.2.2 Containers

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Service Mesh is Red Hat's distribution of the Istio service mesh project, tailored for installation into an OpenShift Container Platform installation.

This advisory covers the RPM packages for the release.

Security Fix(es):

* golang: go/parser: stack exhaustion in all Parse* functions (CVE-2022-1962)
* golang: encoding/xml: stack exhaustion in Decoder.Skip (CVE-2022-28131)
* golang: io/fs: stack exhaustion in Glob (CVE-2022-30630)
* golang: path/filepath: stack exhaustion in Glob (CVE-2022-30632)
* golang: encoding/xml: stack exhaustion in Unmarshal (CVE-2022-30633)
* golang: encoding/gob: stack exhaustion in Decoder.Decode (CVE-2022-30635)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Inconsistent Interpretation of HTTP Requests ('HTTP Request/Response Smuggling')

notes.text: A flaw was found in golang. The HTTP/1 client accepted invalid Transfer-Encoding headers indicating "chunked" encoding. This issue could allow request smuggling, but only if combined with an intermediate server that also improperly accepts the header as invalid.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: net/http: improper sanitization of Transfer-Encoding header
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
The OpenShift Service Mesh Release Notes provide information on the features and known issues:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/latest/service_mesh/v2x/servicemesh-release-notes.html

vulnerabilities.title: golang: net/http: improper sanitization of Transfer-Encoding header

notes.text: A flaw was found in the golang standard library, go/parser. When calling any Parse functions on the Go source code, which contains deeply nested types or declarations, a panic can occur due to stack exhaustion. This issue allows an attacker to impact system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: go/parser: stack exhaustion in all Parse* functions
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

The OpenShift Service Mesh Release Notes provide information on the features and known issues:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/latest/service_mesh/v2x/servicemesh-release-notes.html

vulnerabilities.title: golang: go/parser: stack exhaustion in all Parse* functions

notes.text: A flaw was found in golang encoding/xml. When calling Decoder, Skip while parsing a deeply nested XML document, a panic can occur due to stack exhaustion and allows an attacker to impact system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: encoding/xml: stack exhaustion in Decoder.Skip
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

vulnerabilities.title: golang: encoding/xml: stack exhaustion in Decoder.Skip

notes.text: A flaw was found in the golang standard library, io/fs. Calling Glob on a path that contains a large number of path separators can cause a panic issue due to stack exhaustion. This could allow an attacker to impact availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: io/fs: stack exhaustion in Glob
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

notes.text: A flaw was found in golang. Calling Glob on a path that contains a large number of path separators can cause a panic issue due to stack exhaustion. This can cause an attacker to impact availability.

notes.text: A flaw was found in golang. Calling Unmarshal on an XML document into a Go struct, which has a nested field that uses the "any" field tag, can cause a panic due to stack exhaustion.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: encoding/xml: stack exhaustion in Unmarshal
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.title: golang: encoding/xml: stack exhaustion in Unmarshal

notes.text: A flaw was found in golang. When calling Decoder, Decode on a message that contains deeply nested structures, a panic can occur due to stack exhaustion and allows an attacker to impact system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: encoding/gob: stack exhaustion in Decoder.Decode
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: OpenShift Container Platform (OCP) starting from 4.10 stream is already compiled in the patched version of Go, hence is not affected by this vulnerability.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: A flaw was found in net/http/httputil golang package. When httputil.ReverseProxy.ServeHTTP is called with a Request.Header map containing a nil value for the X-Forwarded-For header, ReverseProxy could set the client IP incorrectly. This issue may affect confidentiality.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: net/http/httputil: NewSingleHostReverseProxy - omit X-Forwarded-For not working
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability
